system.// statisticsInterval: Interval how often the counters for input/output in adapters and controller will be updated
system.// checkDiskInterval: Interval how often the disk size will be checked
system.// compact: Controller will try to start the instances as a part of the same process. No spawn will be done. Only by adapters that support it and have flag compact flag in io-package.json
system.// memLimitWarn: If the available RAM is below this threshold on adapter start, a warning will be logged.
system.// memLimitError: If the available RAM is below this threshold on adapter start, an error will be logged.

backup.// files: Minimal number of backup files, after the deletion will be executed according to backupTime settings
backup.// hours: All backups older than 48 hours will be deleted. But only if the number of files is greater than of backupNumber
backup.// period: by default backup every 2 hours. Time is in minutes. To disable backup set the value to 0
backup.// path: Absolute path to backup directory or empty to backup in data directory

jsonlOptions.// autoCompress (1): The JSONL DB is append-only and will contain unnecessary entries after a while.
jsonlOptions.// autoCompress (2): It will be compressed when the uncompressed size is >= size * sizeFactor AND >= sizeFactorMinimumSize
jsonlOptions.// autoCompress (3): Note that too low values here will cause the DB to be rewritten often.
jsonlOptions.// ignoreReadErrors: If single lines in the DB are corrupted, they can be ignored without losing the whole DB.
jsonlOptions.// throttleFS (1): By default, the database immediately writes to the database file. Write accesses can be reduced using the throttleFS option.
jsonlOptions.// throttleFS (2): Be aware that buffered changes will be lost in case the process crashes.

throttleFS.// intervalMs: Write to the database file no more than every intervalMs milliseconds.
throttleFS.// maxBufferedCommands: Force writing after this many changes have been buffered. This reduces memory consumption and data loss in case of a crash.

syslog1.// host: The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.
syslog1.// port: The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port(514/UDP).
syslog1.// protocolC: The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, unix, unix-connect, etc).
syslog1.// path: The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).
syslog1.// localhost: Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).
syslog1.// sysLogType: The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD).
syslog1.// app_name: The name of the application (Default: process.title).
syslog1.// eol: The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Message without modifications).

seq1.// serverUrl: The http(s) URL including port of the seq server. If you use HTTPS a real certificate is needed; self signed certs are ot accepted.
seq1.// apiKey: The apiKey of the seq system
